fields.name: Attack of the Kretons
fields.description: While searching for a villain who has been terrorizing the countryside, you end up in a pathetic city which is under siege from a horde of Kreton barbarians. Now, you have to figure out what's going on, and why everyone is so crazy about cheesedip.
fields.intro_text:
AUTHOR'S NOTES:

Welcome to my adventure!

This adventure is strictly for laughs and any attempt to take it seriously will only prove you to be a mendicant.

If you have any quarrels with such, go get a life. If you really think some yahoo with a sword can ***seriously*** murder big reptiles and call it a living, I suggest you seek therapy. This game isn't the usual heroic-quest-with-pointless-puzzles computer gamers like to crank out. This one is intended to be funnier than hell!

So, with light-heartedness in hand, be sure to enjoy my game!
---
AUTHOR'S NOTES:

Attack of the Kretons is loosely based on the Groo comic books by Sergio Aragones, an artist for Mad magazine among other things. I can't tell you much, other than that they are the funniest comic books on the market and they are a good influence on young children, with lots of slaying and pillaging.

The most confusing part of the game is in the beginning, as you will have no actual quest at that point. Well, you are in a nigh-helpless city under attack by barbarians. This should pose as a problem for any normal person. Just find out what you can do to help. That's the whole point of the game.

It's important to keep your companions alive, also. Some play crucial roles in the game.

The new command, TALK, is terribly important and you should use it as often as possible. Here's how it works:

TALK TO (person to talk to)

There will be a point in the game where you are incredibly outnumbered. Don't be afraid to use the FLEE command. Remember that you can try to flee in a certain direction (FLEE N, FLEE S, etc.)
---
You've been searching for the villain who's been spreading carnage and death across the land like a plague for almost five months now. In an almost random fashion, towns and villages have been looted, burned, and some leveled to the ground. Nobody has seen any armies, and mages claim that no magic is at work in the land.

You're at a dead end right now. Kreton barbarians have moved south from Kraut because of the Sauer Empire's rule, but they attack in open, and in great numbers. Nobody has any good guesses. You begin to question old drunkards and gossipy women in bazaars.

You found no answers, but some weirdo gave you some cheesedip. You found it odd, but threw it away and went on.
---
You finally wound up in the hick town of Oigres. With little coin and lots of time, you became trapped in this dump of stagnation. You searched the town bazaar (or is it the bizarre town?), but all you could find aside from basic fare was the unusual dependency the populace had upon cheesedip.

In fact the town was cheesedip mad. A bowl of cheesedip accompanied every meal and a watered version was even drank. The odd city didn't prove to be a good place to make any money. A sagging economy, with a pitiful number of merchants, made for poor earnings.

You were on your way out of this bowl of stagnation when a horrified cry broke the monotony!

"Barbarians! A horde of them! Storming the city walls!" cried a sentry.

The ill-equipped guards barely closed the gates in time. Peasants scrambled in and many fell outside the gates. You lent your hand with a bow and shot several of the invaders. They were fat, short, and obnoxious. The dreaded Kretons of Kraut! The most blood-thirsty killers on the planet!

After a short fight, the Kretons fell back and surrounded the city, closing off the only road out of this dump. With your fate sealed, you went to the nearest tavern.

So here you are, not quite sober in a crumbling city under siege by barbarians while an unknown menace waits to strike from the shadows. And you, the only decent adventurer in this death trap!

You sit and ponder-- If you pass out now and the barbarians kill you, will you have an eternal hang over?

Best not find out!

fields.name: in the drunken widow tavern. (N/E)
fields.description: You are sitting on a stool at the bar of a small tavern called the Drunken Widow in a city in lots of trouble. You are uncomfortable because there is a big lump in your seat. The front door is to the north. The restroom is east.

fields.name: in the bazaar. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: You are in a large bazaar in the city. All about are people buying, selling, and trading cheesedip. To the west is a slum, north is a house, south is a bar, and to the east are more vendors.

fields.name: in the Sage's house. (S)
fields.description: You're in the Sage's house. All about are shelves filled with books, tomes, scrolls, records, tablets, notebooks, an abacus, and stone carvings. A door is south.

fields.name: at the end of the street. (N/S/W)
fields.description: All about are street vendors, again peddling cheesedip. North is the city hall, where the Prince holds session. Fittingly, to the south is a seedy rum shop. The road ends abruptly here, but returns west.

fields.name: in the Prince's court. (S)
fields.description: You are in the court of Prince Spagti Thoth, Lord of Oigres. The walls are covered with beautiful tapestries and an atmosphere of merrymaking hangs in the air. A wine stained door is south.

fields.name: in the rum shop. (N)
fields.description: You are in a cheap little rum shop. A quick glance reveals this is no ordinary rum shop, though. For this place also is a supplier of cheesedip! Is nothing sacred? The door that many customers can not find very easily is north.

fields.name: on skid row. (N/E/W)
fields.description: You are on a sleazy street that can very aptly be named Skid Row. All about are signs of neglect. The only open business is an old cheesedip shop to the north that peddles to the bums. To the east is the town square and west is the gate.

fields.name: in a cheesedip shop. (S)
fields.description: You are in a rundown cheesedip shop. A smell of moldy cheesedip hangs in the air. The place is used for the selling, buying and production of cheesedip. The door south is marked "Be a real man! Eat cheesedip or forever be effeminate!"

fields.name: at the city wall. (E/W)
fields.description: Guard posts line the ill-kept brick and mortar wall. All about are makeshift defensive tools. such as catapults and a crude inner wall. The battlefield is west and to the east is the rest of town.

fields.name: on a battlefield. (N/S/E)
fields.description: You are on a wide battlefield east of Oigres. All about you is a crude and barbaric camp set up by the Kretons. To the north and south are paths, and the city gates are east.

fields.name: on the path. (N/S)
fields.description: You are on a craggy path leading north into the mountains and south to the village of Oigres. All about the city is a siege camp. Luckily, the invaders are staying away from here.

fields.name: on the mountain path. (N/S)
fields.description: You're on a mountain path far north of town. Some great mountain peaks reach high into the sky to the north. A crappy little besieged city is south.

fields.name: at a fork in the path. (S/E/W)
fields.description: West is a high mountain peak, east is a craggy pass, and south leads to Oigres.

fields.name: on a mountain path. (E/W)
fields.description: You're on a long mountain path running east and west. The craggy features west would inspire fear in the hearts of all men.

fields.name: at the base of a mountain. (E/U)
fields.description: You are at the base of a great mountain. The winding path back to town is east, but a real hero would climb right up the side of the mountain. The sunlight plays tricks on the canyon walls.

fields.name: on the mountain. (U/D)
fields.description: You are scaling the side of the mountain. A few scrub bushes and scraggly trees make up the only vegetation. A faint trail winds up and down.

fields.name: at the top of the mountain. (W/D)
fields.description: You are near the top of the mountain. A long trail leads down the side of the mountain and back to town. You can also go west into the cave with the painted sign over it.

fields.name: in the cave. (N/S/E)
fields.description: The cave has been remodeled and brick and mortar walls have been erected. Some unnatural passages lead north, south, and east. Odd. There seem to be no guards.

fields.name: in the common room. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: You are in a large common room for a small number of guards. There is lots of the usual litter, spilled wine, and such. There is a barracks east, a mess hall west, and a nice room north.

fields.name: in the Captain's room. (S)
fields.description: You are in the private quarters of the Orc Captain. The room has fairly modest furnishings, save for the nice tapestries on the wall. The slovenly commons room is south.

fields.name: in the mess hall. (E)
fields.description: You are in a degenerate mess hall that certainly lives up to the name. The odor of rotten cheesedip fills the air. Past the dirty tables and splintered benches is a door out.

fields.name: in the barracks. (W)
fields.description: You are in a filthy barracks intended for humanoids with poor health standards. Flea ridden straw bunks make it hard to near the small door to the west.

fields.name: in a dark end of a hallway. (N/W)
fields.description: You are in the south end of a short and wide hallway that runs north. The place is very dark and dreary; rats scurry around in the rubbish and cob webs hang all over. A door is west.

fields.name: in the conjuring room. (E/W)
fields.description: You're in a bizarre room that has lots of funny looking mystical signs painted on its walls, floor and ceiling. A red-brown powder is all over the floor. This place is creepy, so you may wish to leave through one of the doors east and west.

fields.name: in the torture room. (E/W)
fields.description: You are in the room which the witches use for entertainment. That's right! It is the torture room! Equipped with a brand new iron maiden (with salt-tipped spikes), this is truly a fine torture room. There are doors east and west.

fields.name: in the bedroom. (E)
fields.description: You are in the bedroom where Arba and Dakarba sleep and relax. Aside from the comfortable (but cheap) furniture, there is nothing of interest here. The door is east.

fields.name: on the road. (N/S)
fields.description: To the north lies a camp, and to the south is a dark and sinister looking forest. Dark clouds, vultures, swarms of insects, and dragons circle the air above the forest.

fields.name: in the Dark Forest of Ewing. (N/E/W)
fields.description: A path leads out to the north, where the only sunlight enters. Weed and briar entangled paths lead east and west. It's very dark and lots of biting flies are swarming about.

fields.name: on a briar infested path. (E/W)
fields.description: The thorns here are very sharp and tear into your legs. No light seems to be able to filter through the twisted and knotted trees.

fields.name: at a bend in the path. (S/W)
fields.description: The path now runs west and south. The dark and gloomy forest seems to be creeping up closer to your path.

fields.name: on a weed infested path. (S/E)
fields.description: You are on a path that is tangled and clotted with many weeds. The thistles, burrs, nettles, and vines make it rather hard to move.

fields.name: at a bend. (N/E)
fields.description: Again the path bends through the scary forest, now running north and east. The trees appear as twisted monsters. You can see an oak of terrible proportions to the west.

fields.name: at a dead end. (W)
fields.description: The path ends abruptly here, with many tangled vines and briars east and an unscaleable mountain side to the south. You can only go west.

fields.name: at a bend in the path. (N/W)
fields.description: A mountain is south, and the path winds around it to the west. To the north is a tangled and terrible forest.

fields.name: at a dead end. (E)
fields.description: The path ends here, with a tangled mass of vines and briars any northern or western movement and an unscaleable mountain to the south.

fields.name: in a strange passage. (N/S)
fields.description: You are in a strange passage that runs north to the outside and south to God knows what. The walls are inscribed with bizarre writings about how one of these days the world shall be destroyed by an all-encompassing mass of cheesedip.

fields.name: at a bend. (N/E/W)
fields.description: The hall bends north and west and a door lies east. The floor has some tracks running east and west on it. Odd, there are no furnishings as far as you can see.

fields.name: in a common room. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: You are at the eastern end of a hallway. Doors are north, south, and west. The northern one is made of teakwood, the southern pine, and the western door is made of solid oak with great iron bands.

fields.name: in the High Priest's room. (S)
fields.description: You are in a very fine room with silk tapestries and other such finery. There is also a large bookshelf. By the looks, this can only be the High Priest's room.

fields.name: in the acolyte room. (N)
fields.description: You are in the room where all the young acolytes who want to become mindless servants of darkness stay. The floor is bare, as are the stone walls. The northern door has a sign on it.

fields.name: in the vault. (E)
fields.description: You are in a large damp room that was carved right out of the rock. It is very damp and dark. The way out is through an oak door east.

fields.name: at the Altar of Cheesedip. (W)
fields.description: You are at a great marble altar to the sickening false god of cheesedip. Bowls of sacrificial Monterey Jack and cheddar sit next to the raised dais. Past the pews for the deviants is an arch, west.

fields.name: at a narrow pass. (E/W)
fields.description: You are in a narrow east-west running pass between two great slabs of granite. The heath pines and large rocks laying in the path make it look as if few people ever travel east from here.

fields.name: at a bend. (N/W)
fields.description: The granite cliffs are even higher and steeper here. The path appears to end north.

fields.name: at the end of the path. (N/S)
fields.description: The path ends here, with a big cave lying north. The front of the cave has nicely crushed rock in front of it, like a road or sidewalk.

fields.name: in a cave. (S)
fields.description: You are in a comfortable little cave. It is warm and well lit, and some kind of magic force field seems to be preventing drafts. Large plush chairs line the walls and the exit is south.

fields.name: in the Arena of Aries.
fields.description: You are in a large marble arena. Dead gladiators are littered across the floor, and thousands of spectators cheer in the stands. Sitting in the judge's seat is the Wizard of the Unknown!

fields.name: on the plane of stench. (S)
fields.description: You are in an odd looking land. Everything is broken and hideous, the trees twisted and deformed. Lying heavy in the air is an indescribable stench. A castle lies south.

fields.name: at the entrance to a castle. (N/E)
fields.description: You are standing before a great castle. It is very squat and broad, unlike all those towering 200 foot tall towers that you are used to. A foul smelling aura of evil emanates from the open black iron gate.

fields.name: in a black room. (S/E/W)
fields.description: You are in a room of utter blackness. All the furniture and decorations are pitch black. Luckily, you can find the black painted doors south, east, and west through the blackened cliche.

fields.name: in the Cheesedip of Eternity. (W)
fields.description: Whoa! You are in a bizarre hyper-cosmic dimensional vortex of cheesedip matter that is commonly known as the Cheesedip of Eternity. All you can see is an eternal amount of cheesedip, and a door floating in the cheesedip to the west.

fields.name: in the hall of death. (N/E)
fields.description: You are in a gigantic hall made from a strange black rock. Occasionally, white marble skulls decorate the floor. Chills run down your spine as you glance for the exit (which is east).

fields.name: in a large chamber. (W/S)
fields.description: This chamber is large, but not quite as large as the one to the west which seems to serve no purpose at all. When you reach the end of your quest, you think you'll study extra-dimensional architecture. A big door is south and a hall is west.

fields.name: in the room of odd proportions. (N/E/W)
fields.description: You are in a bizarre room that breaks all the laws of geometry and logic. Large objects fit in small ones, obtuse angles behave acutely, and there's no gravity. There are tesseract shaped doors north, east and west.

fields.name: in the teleporter room. (W)
fields.description: You are in a large room with many big, confusing devices that are both magical and mechanical. Painted on the floor in some strange letters is "Teleportation Chamber". A door is west.

fields.name: in the billiards room. (S/E)
fields.description: You are in the billiards room. You see some tacky green wallpaper and trim that highlight an orangutan named Joey. Some gaudy, fake Tiffany lamps illuminate the area. You can see doors east and south.

fields.name: in a charred room. (N/S)
fields.description: You're in a square room made from stone blocks. The blocks are all blackened and charred, as are the doors. A magical symbol is drawn in red ink on the floor.

fields.name: in a palacial dwelling. (N/E)
fields.description: You are in a great palacial dwelling. Beautiful flowers and plants adorn the well lit room. Great silk sofas line the walls in comfort. A gold door with gem mosaics is east.

fields.name: in a giant, grimy altar. (W)
fields.description: You are in a giant altar like room; a smell of ancient cheesedip pervades the air. The floor is all grimy and filthy. Immense braziers burn fiercely, providing light in this hellish pit.

fields.name: in the restroom. (W)
fields.description: It smells of hideous things that you have a hard time recognizing. The flies buzz in through a door to the west.

fields.name: on a hidden path. (E/W)
fields.description: You are on a dark, hidden path which runs west through the murky forest. A swarm of biting flies fills the air with a hideous buzzing sound. The main path is east.

fields.name: at the end of the path. (E)
fields.description: There is a thick wall of trees on all sides but east. The crooked and warped trees give the place an eerie feel. A deep hole is dug in the ground.

fields.name: swords of Groo
fields.description: You see an unwieldy pair of swords. A small mark on the hilt of each identifies them as a pair of the famous Aragones blades, some of the most deadly weapons ever made.

fields.name: oak door
fields.description: Preventing entry to the north house is a large oak door. It has an elaborate brass knocker, and on it is written, "The Sage Residence".

fields.name: cheesedip
fields.description: You see a small bowl of cheesedip. It sits on the bar, as if people here eat it like civilized people eat goat's horn stew.

fields.name: casks
fields.description: Up against the wall are many great casks that are labeled, "Cheesedip. Handle With Care!"

fields.name: catalog
fields.description: You see a very thick and unusual book. The cover is made from an unusual skin with many deep purple scales on it. The title reads, "The Wizard's Catalog to Strange and Hard to Get Equipment."

fields.name: slums to the east
fields.description: To the east there is nothing but vast slums. An old man fends off rats from his meal of garbage, a family retreats to their shack to hide from the Kretons. All about are bums, devouring bowls of cheesedip.

fields.name: mashed pile of guts
fields.description: You see a pile of maimed body parts. A broken lyre and a tattered green and yellow diamond studded suit are mixed up within the pile. Somebody should clean this mess up.

fields.name: city gate
fields.description: Preventing the barbarians from simply walking into the city is a huge oak door with steel reinforcing strips.

fields.name: camp
fields.description: The soldiers have set up their camp. A number of tents, firepits, and weapon racks are here. They look rather shabby.

fields.name: Namton
fields.description: You see Captain Anthrax's weapon. An extremely unusual sword with a green glow about the razor sharp edge. Writing etched on the blade in silver reads, "Namton". The pommel has a sneering face on it.

fields.name: Kreton camp
fields.description: All about are thousands of Kretons, a whole horde of them, in fact. They have surrounded the city and are planning to invade soon. They've sent out a group to kill you!

fields.name: road sign
fields.description: In front of the gates is a road sign. It says: "EAST- OIGRES, WEST- ELANS, NORTH- THE MOUNTAINS OF CHAKAAL, SOUTH- THE DARK FOREST OF EWING". It appears somebody has crossed over "Elans" and carved "Barbarian Horde" next to it.

fields.name: craggy features
fields.description: To the west there are some rocks that resemble Margaret Thatcher in the nude.

fields.name: road sign
fields.description: Loosely buried in the ground is a road sign. It reads "WEST- MOUNT PIZZANT, EAST- UNKNOWN".

fields.name: sign
fields.description: There is a great sign above the cave, carved in marble with gold and silver lettering and many bizarre runes.

fields.name: Slayer
fields.description: You see Chichester's sword, a blade of razor sharpness with a nasty glow about it. Engraved in jet black runes on the blade is the name "Slayer".

fields.name: bronze door
fields.description: To the west you see a great big bronze door with the inscription, "Oigresian Bronze Foundry" on it.

fields.name: bronze key
fields.description: You see a large bronze key.

fields.name: bound dog
fields.description: Tied up with some twine and placed in the middle of a magic circle is a poor and frightened hound who might be eaten or sacrificed or something else entirely dreadful.

fields.name: bound sage
fields.description: Bound in but his underwear and hung on the rack is a poor old man with a white beard. He looks at you with sad eyes, a portrait of pain. He weakly opens his mouth to say, "Kill them! Rip their arms off like daisy petals!"

fields.name: staff of incineration
fields.description: You see the Sage's walking stick, which he also uses as a weapon. Of course! The bladders of mystical liquid and the magical end for spraying and igniting make this a staff of incineration.

fields.name: pigs
fields.description: You see many pigs, all labeled with names of Orcish descent, like "Grag" or "Zod", crammed into the corner.

fields.name: chest
fields.description: You see a large brass chest labeled in big black letters, "Magic Stuff, Handle With Care".

fields.name: brass key
fields.description: You see a small brass key that Dakarba was carrying in her pocket.

fields.name: wand of water and frost
fields.description: You see a cool blue wand with strange runes engraved on its side in silver. It has a diamond tip, and a small tag tied to the end that reads "Wand of Water and Frost. Found in Treasure Horde-- 1/5/65".

fields.name: 1000 kopins
fields.description: You see a large bag of coins with a "K" stamped on the side.

fields.name: brandy
fields.description: You see a keg of brandy, 198 proof.

fields.name: fish key
fields.description: You see the key to the Sage's front door. It is made of iron and is carved to look like a fish.

fields.name: tapestries
fields.description: You see many fine tapestries made from silk. They are colorful and depict a scene in which an ugly, but powerful, man with linguini thick legs is hacking and slicing the crap out of some orcs, save one in finery who is hiding from him.

fields.name: healing potion
fields.description: You see a large crystal bottle filled with a murky blue liquid. Etched into the side of the bottle is "Uncle Arnie's Grand Healing Potion-- Works on Wounds, Aches, Colds, Fevers and Allergies".

fields.name: leather book
fields.description: You see a large leather bound book. On its cover is the title, "Cults and Religions of the World".

fields.name: sword
fields.description: You see the ordinary sword that was a lethal weapon in the hands of the skillful Taranto.

fields.name: granite slab
fields.description: On the side of the mountain is a great slab of granite with an emblem that represents a large bowl of cheesedip.

fields.name: grateful dead
fields.description: An amazing transition has taken place on the hellious drooling death zombies! They are no longer tormented souls, they're just plain zombies and very grateful for it. The zombies walk about saying, "Thank you."

fields.name: oak door
fields.description: You see a large oak door to the west. It has iron bands around it to prevent people from breaking it down.

fields.name: La Codex du Cheesedip
fields.description: You see an ancient tome written on leather and bound with iron. Mystic symbols are drawn into the cover, and written across the top is its title: La Codex du Cheesedip. This is a hidden and feared book of blasphemous secrets.

fields.name: sign
fields.description: You see a nice plain sign hanging on a door.

fields.name: iron key
fields.description: You see a large iron key marked, "THIS KEY OPENS THE VAULT OF UNKNOWN HORRORS/BROOM CLOSET".

fields.name: grateful dead
fields.description: An amazing transition has taken place on the hellious drooling death zombies! They are no longer tormented souls, they're just plain zombies and very grateful for it. The zombies walk about saying, "Thank you."

fields.name: jars
fields.description: There are many great jars here that have a strange seal of a sneering face and the word "Cheesedip" on them.

fields.name: kopins
fields.description: In one of the jars was a king's ransom in gold! Actually, it isn't that much. Maybe if the people didn't like the king too much and the kidnappers would take anything they could get... Anyway, there are about 500 kopins here.

fields.name: Wand of Castratia
fields.description: You see a bizarre wand with some runes on it. The tip is shaped like a magic marker and somebody put a tag on the end that reads, "Wand of Castratia-- No known purpose or use."

fields.name: statue of the cheesedip god
fields.description: Sitting upon the altar is a large and hideous statue of a bizarre, shapeless mass of slime. It is carved in gold and has ivory details with many gems inlaid in it. A small sign on its base reads "Sorrimat".

fields.name: Orb of Evanyur
fields.description: You see a translucent, shimmering orb that rests upon a velvet pillow, on a marble pedestal. A name plate next to the pillow reads, "The Orb of Evanyur".

fields.name: club
fields.description: You see the giant tree trunk that Manly Max wielded as a club.

fields.name: Sniveling Sissy
fields.description: You see a giant lying on the ground, stripped of all manhood and maturity. He screams, whines, bawls, throw tantrums, and pouts. He makes you sick.

fields.name: stone eagles
fields.description: Two giant stone eagles guard the cave to the north. They look very realistic, with nice expressional detail. Written upon the bases that they sit on is, "SAY THE PASSWORD".

fields.name: Crystal of Krossos
fields.description: You can't see it, but you can feel the weight the Crystal of Krossos puts on your hand.

fields.name: battle axe
fields.description: You see Conan's battle axe, made of cheap imported Hyborian alloy.

fields.name: cigarette pack
fields.description: Chichester was carrying a pack of long black cigarettes. A gold label wrapped around the pack reads, "Long Black Brand".

fields.name: cigarette
fields.description: There was one last cigarette inside of the pack. It is long and black.

fields.name: secret message
fields.description: You see a small note, obviously it's a secret message!

fields.name: brooms
fields.description: You see some brooms in the corner.

fields.name: gold
fields.description: Stuck underneath your seat was a sack of gold! Looks like about 75 kopins.

fields.name: corpses
fields.description: Scores of corpses are scattered about the area.

fields.name: giant stone statue
fields.description: Sitting next to the gate is a gigantic stone statue. It is carved to resemble a very solemn looking man.

fields.name: magazine
fields.description: Here is a copy of the latest issue of "Ebony" magazine that has interviews with Bo Jackson, black working women and the heavy metal band Living Colour. What an interesting combination.

fields.name: album
fields.description: You see an old Black Sabbath album in the original jacket. The cover depicts a giant toad eating some babies. Just what all the demons want in their record collections!

fields.name: scythe
fields.description: You see a scythe glowing with a hellishly terrifying green fire.

fields.name: thud-whacker
fields.description: You see a fine lead thud-whacker. It's sack cloth is filled with some fine lead shot used to beat people, like a club or blackjack.

fields.name: pun book
fields.description: You see a large red book titled, "Bob's 10,000 Puns".

fields.name: north door
fields.description: There is a charred and blackened door on the north wall.

fields.name: south door
fields.description: There is a charred and blackened door on the south wall.

fields.name: blob of cheesedip
fields.description: All about the room is a shapeless mass of smelly, old cheesedip. It has many wires and shredded pieces of electronic equipment intertwined in it. There must be at least nine tons of cheesedip here.

fields.name: electronics equipment
fields.description: A large panel filled with many various electronic pieces used in the control of robots is behind the altar.

fields.name: paper
fields.description: Mr. Roessler had a sheet of paper in a fold in his shirt.

fields.name: bound man
fields.description: Bound up in front of the statue is an old man. He has strange markings on him, as if the cult wants to sacrifice him. A look of terror is in his eyes.

fields.name: map
fields.description: A map was on the old man's body.

fields.name: Amulet of Ian
fields.description: You see a great amulet of gold with a brilliant sapphire set in its center with rays coming from it. Magical runes are on the front, but on the back is written, "Ho! This amulet brings death to those with poor choice of legwear!"

fields.name: secret path leading west
fields.description: Through the roots of the giant oak tree, you see a secret path going west.

fields.name: pigs
fields.description: You see an entire herd of pigs in the corner of Chichester's room.

fields.name: wooden box
fields.description: Inside the hole was a dirty and beaten old wooden box.

fields.text: After he bites the cap off a bottle, Mike growls, "Well, this is a hard time, dammit. Don't have any idea how to stop the damn Kretons or that thing that trashed Elans and Arbor, dammit, but if the sage were here he would. Dammit."
The minstrel ponders a moment and then says, "Ah-ha! I shall sing the song of Groo!" With that he strums his lyre.
"Once, in the days of yore, when knights slew dragons galore, and wizards conjured spells to raise demons from the hells, there was a wanderer named Groo.
"Groo was a lover of the fray, and with glee he would slay all those whom he would cross would have their innards tossed. Groo became a Captain for King Wazoo..."
A man enters the tavern and sits next to you. He says, "Hey! What a great song!"
"Groo had to guard a trestled bridge, to keep enemies from the ridge. Alas, he let the dread foe cross, and a crucial battle 'twas lost. Cried Groo, 'The bridge is unhurt!'"
The oaf next to you is screaming with laughter, "What a loser! What a total mendicant!"
"The King cried, 'You are a mendicant! Slay the witch of Mount Pizzant!' Groo went to the mountain, hidden in fog, where the witch turned him into a frog. So the King did decree..."
"Wait! Wait! That's not how it was!" Shouts the loud man next to you, "I was there and I... I..." He leaps upon the minstrel and begins to hack furiously.
The minstrel's last words are: "Groo's failures are so numerous, he does not find it humorous. Now he's bent on shredding me, on maiming and beheading me, Now <SLASH!> ...urrrggg..."

Groo announces, "Dare not sing such a song to me! I am in no mood for such little annoyances, as I am looking for my lost friend, known as the sage!"

Iron Mike snarls, "You better clean up that mess, dammit!"

Our services are 100% confidential and private. No Sorcerer will know of your purchases from us. Also, we guarantee your total satisfaction. If any of our products fail to meet your requirements, please return it for a full refund.
Basilisk's scale lotion: This is one nasty ointment of love. Guaranteed to drive any non-possessed person into lust convulsions. Don't let that sorceress think you're just a card trick!
The sage sees you reading his catalog and shouts, "Hey you leave that alone! It has many very, er, unusual magic potions that I need. It's mine! Give it back!" With that he tears the book away.
As you look through the further items you feel a growing sensation of nausea. My God! How can it do that? This sage is not exactly what his reputation makes him out to be... Fur coated? How? Why?

Groo shouts, "This sure is one hell of a defense session! Reminds me of the debauchery we used to have way back when in the army of King Wazoo... I remember once we took a whole ox and boiled it in a vat of wine, didn't skin it, though..."
The Prince turns indignant and starts to drunkenly rant at Groo. "Begone, ye shtupid mendicant, my defensh ish de bes defensh... Fight dem mudderf..." The prince passes out on his throne.
(Haacck) "Well once wiles I is walkin out in da (Kafff) woodsh I did see me a number o' lights doin sum (Blech) pret' strange tings, I sez..." coughs the pathetic old rum pot.
"Hmmmm... The word on the grapevine is that the witches Arba and Dakarba had an axe to grind with the Sage. I couldn't tell you what, though, but I'd like to know..." the old woman whispers.

"Weh buddy... I wuz jest lookin in da sky one day when all o' a suddin dis big ol' bat ting with fire en eez eyes jest woooshed! down an snatched up da sage!" The drunk then mumbles something about a lady who lived in a shoe...
Kurk says, "Hell no. Why should I? Too much trouble." and doesn't move from the top of his barrel.
"Shaddup, pinhead. Why don't you just go and screw yerself. Oh yeah, why don't you just have a rat chew that big thing off the top of your neck." says the ever articulate Kurk.
Groo gives you a dumb look and a grunt of acknowledgment.

The almost sober guards grab a hold of Groo and throw him out the door! "Hey!" he cries, "I suppose you guys are not too interested in the ox? OK. I didn't say I was gonna make you eat it, come on, let go! Arrrrggggh!"
The soldiers refuse to open the gates, so you have to leap over the wall. You land safely on the other side, save that you are in the midst of some hostile barbarians.
"Well, if that pinhead Prince we have gets off his can and puts some time and money into this, we may not be killed or sold into slavery." grumbles the optimistic Captain.
The Kretons shout, "We shall teach you the meaning of pain!" Groo retorts, "Ha! I already know that one! What does 'mendicant' mean, though?"

The soldiers open the gates for you. A battalion has to fight off the scores of Kretons rushing in, trying to get to the open gate. Many brave young Oigresians die, but you get in the town, you greedy heel.

The Kretons can't abandon their posts, so they taunt you. "Hey, little girly man, come back and fight or are you just too wimpy? Hear us now and believe us later but never think about it, we are the Kretons, the real men that you aren't!"
The conjurors inside are card carrying members of the National Organization for Witches. Remember our motto: Witches have rites too!

"Arba and Dakarba have had us working in this lousy slop hole for twenty years and whadda we get? Room, board and a pig every six months! Dammit all, we want at least three pigs a year or we'll never guard this place again!"
Chichester looks at you and pulls out a long black cigarette. He lights it and takes a few puffs. With a cultured voice he says, "Well, well, my good chap. It does seem that we have a common enemy."
"Let me join you," he adds. "I can aid you in your quest, starting with giving you a key to the witches' inner sanctum." He puffs a ring from his long black cigarette in your face.
Chichester says with his annoying and snotty voice, "Well?" and puffs that awful long black cigarette in your face. Apparently all orcs are jerks in one way or another.
"Ya-ha-ha! I'll get you my pretty, and your little dog too!"
Dakarba grabs the Sage by the neck and hits him with a rubber hose. "Tell us, old fool! Tell us!" She grabs a thumb clamp and clamps it on his thumb. "Tell us you stupid old man! We demand to know!"

The Sage writhes in pain! "I can't... tell you if I don't <ARRRGGGH!> know... the question! Yeeaggh!" Dakarba jabs him with a red hot iron and shouts, "We want to know the name of your stupid dog!" She kicks him in the ribs.
The Sage says, "Yes, that is a terribly interesting topic, but I know everything there is to know about it, so just shut up before I cuff you."
You talk to the dog. He does not talk back, but he does urinate on your leg for being such a moronic putz.

The Sage takes you to his house. There he plies through many tomes of ancient and forgotten lore. He examines a map of the city, the defense plans, this quarter's economic report, and consults his astrology charts.

Finally, he comes to a conclusion. "I, I need some brandy! Lots, and fast! Run and get me some, else our fate is sealed by the sinister forces of the barbarous Kretons! Quickly, here is the key to my front door!" He hands you a key.

The Sage guzzles the brandy down as if there were no tomorrow and soon he enters a strange meditative trance. "Ah ha!" he states, "The problem is that the evil Cheesedip God has turned the people of Oigres into mindless slaves of his horrid cult, the Sakainluth. If the city of Oigres were to fall to the Kretons, they could easily extend their reach far into the north. We must find their base of operations and drive them out..."

You check the brandy to make sure it's not drugged. To your grief, it isn't. Groo ponders a moment and asks, "So our problem is that a cult that worships a big cheesedip is secretly corrupting the city?"

The Sage replies, "If you could put it in simple layman's terms, yes. But actually they are but pawns in the unnameable God of Cheesedip's plan for world conquest. He promises his cultees cheap thrills, but he doesn't deliver."
Groo has a look of shock on his face. He says, "Of course! It's all so clear now!"

The cult of Sakainluth worships an entity of cheesedip known as Sorrimat. They are very seclusive and tend to hide in forests and caves. Due to a lapse in security, the Wizard Tim of Antioch was able to find the secret password which will get you into most of their covens. The word is "DHOUD". However, Tim adds, the Sakainluth are very unpleasant hosts and tried to slay him several times.
The Peasant Pillagers shout, "You will respect the Peasant Pillagers!" Groo laughs, "Ha-ha! Groo doesn't have any respect for himself, let alone others!"
The priest looks at you and his pupils dilate, "Yeah, man." he says.

yakittydemonyakterribleyakhorrid yakblahblahsinisterblahblahhellishblah sonofdarknessyakkittyyakyakyak. Once againyakblahblah returnyakkittyevilblah blahblah. The book is full of sinister blasphemies that poison your mind.

However, one passage makes some sense. "To gain entry to the plane of most sinister and overwhelming stench, where dwells the Great Cheesedip, hold in your hand the sacred Orb of Evanyur and say this incantation: "IMTU KHOUL".
It says, "The Big Cheesedip is watching you!" Beneath is a picture of a large blob of cheesedip with eyes staring at you.
"Hmmm... Sounds like Oigres is pretty badly messed up. We'll have to hurry back and do some research!"

You tell the Prince of what you read, and of how you need his orb. He slurs, "Shur, jes bring me the most purty stone on Earth: The Crystal of Krossos, which iss kept by de Wizard of th' Unknown! Go fort and Godshpeed!"
An eagle picks you up in his beak and gently sets you down, preventing you from getting in the cave. He says, "Tsk, tsk, tsk, it would be cheating if you didn't say THE PASSWORD!"
"I am the protector of the Crystal of Krossos. Do you want it or something?" (Just REQUEST it from him.)
"Ha-ha! If you want it, you must fight in the arena of Aries!" With that, you are transported through space and time!
You are teleported back to the cave! The Wizard is waiting for you, sitting on a plush chair.
"Great fights! I must've earned fifty thousand kopins on admissions alone! Here, you've earned the lousy rock." He hands you a heavy jewel, that you can't see! You stare at him in shock.
"Oh!" he says "I forgot to tell you a rather little known fact about it, only men who have washed away their common sense with wine can see the Crystal of Krossos!"
The Prince screams, "Toga! Toga! Toga!"
The Prince grabs the crystal from your hands and says, "Ooh! It matches my robes perfectly! You can have that ugly orb, but I must warn you, it doesn't go with anything!"
You say the words, and you are pushed in a direction you never though you could move in before! You feel nauseous, but soon you are on solid, unearthly ground.
Conan bellows, "The best things in life are to crush your enemies, to drive them before you, and the lamentation of their women!"
You have the secret message for this adventure! The Groo Crew would be proud.
Sorry, I'm licensed to sell only to a citizen of Oigres or an exporter.
When you free the dog, he leaps up and runs around the room with incredible speed!
Groo adds, "I don't know, but he looks tasty!"
The Sage growls, "You ignorant sack of sheep crap! Do I have to lead you around everywhere?!? C'mon, go south, east and south again to the liquor store! How hard could that be? Let's go!"
You hear a booming voice: "So you dare to enter the confines of the Mighty Sorrimat? Then burn, mortal!" Flickers of flame begin to quickly rise up from the symbol on the floor.
The Sage goes nuts and shouts, "Wait a second! Just how the hell do you expect me to believe in a woman who is gorgeous and seven feet tall and can lug around, let alone even use, a six foot sword?"

"Well...." says Chakaal.

"And another thing, how do you stay so pretty fighting monsters? Isn't that messy work? You watched way too much of 'Conan', young lady. Get out of here."

The statue bellows, "Go no further!"

Groo asks, "Why not?"

"Because!" booms the statue.

"Because why?" asks Groo in a cynical voice.

"How should I know? I can't go inside and look!" booms the statue angrily.

Living Colour kicks a lot more ass than the Rolling Stones, whom they are opening for in the Steel Wheels tour. If you had any brains you'd have seen them when they were touring with Anthrax, the baddest of all bands. It's your loss.
Side 1: Kill; Mutilate; Sacrifice; Eat Babies -- Side 2: Kill, Sacrifice and Eat Babies; Be Mean; Pick Your Nose. Black Sabbath thanks the forces of evil for making them the hit that they are now.
"Wait a second!" you say, "There's no such thing as a Hellious Drooling Death Zombie! How silly of me to fall for the other ones!" You point to the zombies, "You heard me! Get the hell out!"

The zombies are confused at first, but your words soak in. With disappointed faces, the zombies slowly mope away, one by one, and that takes almost three weeks. The final one shouts back to you as he leaves, "Gee, you're a weenie!"

Chichester shouts, "Stop right there! I just realized that there is no such thing as a Hellious Drooling Death Zombie. I am embarrassed that I ever fell for such a bogus hoax. Now move along. Get out of here." and points to the zombies.

The zombies are shocked at first, but they slowly begin to mope away, all with saddened countenances. You wait for them to clear out. This takes four weeks. As they leave, one yells to Chichester, "You didn't have to ruin our fun."
German sausage is the wurst, and their kids are brats! No wonder those Krauts are sour! (Tell audience of idiots about sauer kraut.)
The flames burst into a ball of fire! You are no longer an adventurer, but a crispy critter. Better luck next time!
The wand glows and a small snow storm is created in the room! The snow and wind soon extinguish the flames with an irritating 'hisssss!'
The Cheesedip God laughs an evil laugh, booms "Behold my awesome power!" and begins to melt your brain!
Groo charges the Cheesedip God with blades flashing in a furious storm of steel. He slices and mangles his way through it and discovers a small closet of hidden equipment behind the altar!
While in the teleportation chamber say, "CAWTEENAHMOSH" to be teleported to the realms of men.

The old man begins to rant: "I've seen him! Terrible! The horror, the horror! The cheese that melts! Joey the Talking Orangutan! Only the Amulet of Ian can stop him! Oh! Horror! The horror... Rosebud!" the old man has died from fright.
The map shows a secret path leading to the west from the southwest corner of the woods. A caption reads, "A great oak covers the path, the Amulet of Ian is hidden at the end in a hole."
The amulet glows slightly and a voice says, "There is no tacky legwear that I can find to destroy..."

The amulet bursts a fiery blast of red light from the center! Lightning bolts begin to strike from it randomly, and a storm of fireballs rains from the sky! Mr. Roessler is struck by a burning ray that blows his entrails about!
Mr. Roessler coughs up some blood and begins to gasp his final words: "...Sage, before I die, I must know... the name of your stupid dog..." -- "It's Mulch," replies the Sage.
"Of course," says Mr. Roessler, "it all makes sense now." and he dies.
The Jovial Reaper chuckles, "Did your mother have any kids that lived?"

The minstrel talks to Groo and begins to sing a song. Groo attacks and slays the poor man. You ask why, and Groo says, "It is terrible for a man to torture cats in such a manner. Although I saw no cats, I heard them being strangled."
You find yourself in the Drunken Widow. Strangely, the bar is empty, so you go outside to see where everybody has gone.
The people of Oigres are no longer the mindless slaves of Mr. Roessler A.K.A. the Cheesedip God! The people have built up the city's defenses and joined the soldiers in fighting off the Kretons!

Captain Anthrax leads the charge into the camp of the remaining Kretons and slaughters them. The returning army, led by the angry citizens of Oigres, marches to the city hall and lynches the despicable Prince Spagti Thoth.
The new city council has declared that on Monday there shall be a festival and that you and your companions will be the guests of honor.

At the banquet, the Mayor of Oigres, a man named Belladonna, makes a speech: "If it wasn't for this fine adventurer, we'd probably be dead right now. Unless you like the idea, I suggest you cheer." They all cheer.
After the drunken revelry you rest in the room the council rented for you. You talk to Groo for a while and finally you come to talk of how you two met.
You tell him the story of how you were looking for the cause of all the havoc in the neighboring cities and how you became stuck in this one-time dump.

"Strange," says Groo. "I visited those cities. I remember that in each one I was always thrown out of inns because I lacked in coin and I was called a mendicant. So I..." he pauses, "I have to leave now." He leaves in a hurry.

"How very, very strange," you think as you walk to the city clerk to pick up your reward of the standard five grand. After you pick up the gold and before you leave for the Main Hall, you decide to get a drink at the Drunken Widow.

An old man in a long flowing grey robe walks up to you and says, "Are you the one who saved this city?" You say yes. "Well, far to the west the evil..." You get up and leave before he can say one more word.
"Watch it! Put that thing down!" says Chichester, "Wouldn't you rather talk things over?"
Your brain has been melted to a runny glob of mush. This ruins your chances of being alive, let alone entering Stanford.
Groo does not know how to die! Nor how to tie a tie, mulch, raise cattle, or melt cheesedip!
GRRRR.... A low rumble is made as the great stone slab slowly moves to the side, revealing a passage south!
The wand glows and shoots a blast of searing energy at Max! He is suddenly reduced to a sniveling, whining sissy!
"What a neat dog!" says Chichester, "I wonder what his name is."
Groo has smashed most of it. Only one button still functions, and when you press it you hear a shrill whine. A puff of smoke escapes from the machine and it goes silent.

fields.name: Iron Mike
fields.description: You see a strongly built, but fat and aging, bartender who is tending to the bar and keeping the drinks mickeyed. He grabs you by the neck and snarls, "I'm Iron Mike, the world's meanest barkeep, dammit!" with that, he spits in a beer.

fields.name: Minstrel
fields.description: You see a frail man in a silly-looking green and yellow minstrel's outfit. He claims to be singing songs for only the joy of spreading cheer and merriment. Of course, his suit--as flamboyant as it is--is diamond studded.

fields.name: Groo
fields.description: You see a short but powerful man. His arms are like tree trunks, his neck a bull's, his legs of twig and his mind of stone. His face is uglier than any you have yet to see, yet somehow this gross little mutant seems benevolent.

fields.name: Cheesy Woman
fields.description: A cheesy lady sitting under a tarp is selling great bowls of molten cheesedip.

fields.name: Rioter
fields.description: All about are a great many Oigresians, either hiding cheesedip (in case the Kretons eat it all) or panicking about, wildly screaming about how they will surely die. Many are doing both.

fields.name: Prince Spagti Thoth
fields.description: Sitting at the end of a long table and in a brightly stained robe is the Prince of Oigres, Spagti Thoth. He sits in a drunken stupor as he makes lewd suggestions to the serving wenches.

fields.name: Debaucher
fields.description: All about are many wild deviants. They guzzle wine and ale, do terribly lewd things in plain sight and eat many bowls of cheesedip. Apparently this is the Prince's defense planning session!

fields.name: Steel Stan
fields.description: A short and fat, though rather strong looking man is behind the counter. He gives you a nasty stare. He growls, "I am Steel Stan, Iron Mike's brother and if you ever want wholesale booze real cheap, look no further."

fields.name: Old Crony
fields.description: Sitting in the corner of the bar is an old man who's probably had so many drinks over the years he's been totally preserved by the alcohol. He stares about the room, watchful but drunk.

fields.name: Drunk
fields.description: Sitting on the curb with a half-emptied bottle of cheesedip/rum mix is a sleazy drunk.

fields.name: Kurk
fields.description: Sitting on the top of a beer barrel is an adolescent with acne and a weight problem. He asks, "Watcha want, creep?"

fields.name: Soldier
fields.description: Posted here to prevent the barbarians from over running the city are several hundred soldiers. They look grim, as if they know the odds aren't in their favor.

fields.name: Captain Anthrax
fields.description: Watching over the soldiers is a tall, muscular man. Mean and lean, he is not one to fool around with, for this is the greatest tactical commander in the land, Captain Anthrax!

fields.name: Kreton
fields.description: A small band of crude barbarians have been sent out to kill you. They drool, behave like idiots, and stink; they must be the dreaded Kretons!

fields.name: Striking Orc
fields.description: There are several orcs in chain armor carrying scimitars here, alas, the poor beasts also carry signs reading "Union", "Arba and Dakarba Unfair to Guards" and "Fringe Benefits for Orcs".

fields.name: Chichester
fields.description: Here, reading, is a truly exceptional orc dressed in finery and silk. Unlike most orcs, he is clean and doesn't smell bad. He has a noble flair and carries a jeweled magic sword. Alas, this is not a common orc, but a princely one.

fields.name: Hideous Demon Thing
fields.description: A cloud of smoke in the room condenses into the semi-humanoid, semi-reptilian, semi-arachnid, semi-mollusk demon thing. Its hideous red eyes stare at you with hatred. Therefore, it's a hideous demon thing.

fields.name: Dog
fields.description: A muddled looking pooch with brown fur and black spots is here. He's cute and furry, as all dogs should be. You wonder what the name of such a cute dog could be.

fields.name: Arba
fields.description: You see a tall witch with long dark hair and a body with all the curves. She wears a sleazy blue dress and a gold hat with a bat on it.

fields.name: Dakarba
fields.description: A short, fat witch in a goofy looking purple traditional witches' outfit is here. "Yah ha-ha-ha!" she cackles in an insane fit, "I'll get you, and your little dog too!"

fields.name: Sage
fields.description: You see a kindly old man with a rather wise look in his eye. He is the Sage, a wiseman or wiseguy, depending on who it is you ask. He is the only one wise enough to save Oigres.

fields.name: Big Bad Bear
fields.description: It seems that you have disturbed a big bad brown bear because you banged your baggage on some bark. He rears up to his full height of nine feet and lets loose a terrifying roar!

fields.name: Taranto
fields.description: A tall man in armor with only one eye stops you. "Ho!" he says "I am Taranto and these are my loyal men, the Peasant Pillagers." He indicates a cut-throat band of thieves. "Anyway," he says, "it is our duty to pillage you."

fields.name: Peasant Pillager
fields.description: You see a band of cut-throat thieves. They look at you like a starving wolf looks at a plump sheep. They grab their weapons and charge you.

fields.name: Hellious Drooling Death Zombie
fields.description: Oh no! Your way is blocked by guards, though they're not alive! Their flesh is rotten, their eyes burn unearthly fire, green slime drips from their chins. These can only be Hellious Drooling Death Zombies!

fields.name: High Priest
fields.description: Inhaling some strange incense that has the smell of burnt banana peels is a small man in flowing robes. With a wild look in his eyes, he rises, points his bony fingers at you and screams, "Begone, ye blasphemers!"

fields.name: Acolyte
fields.description: Several young men in brown robes with large helmets making their heads look like blobs of cheesedip see you, and in unison they scream, "Arrrrgggh! A blasphemer! Convert him to the light!"

fields.name: Hellious Drooling Death Zombie
fields.description: Oh no! Hellious Drooling Death Zombies are guarding the area. They moan in eternal agony and stagger a lot; however, inside their mucus soaked jaws are some nasty, pointy teeth.

fields.name: Manly Max
fields.description: A powerfully built giant, at least 75 feet tall, snarls at you and blocks your way. He is clad in a fur coat, shiny shoes and a thick gold chain. He bellows, "I am Manly Max, literally, the biggest stud there is! Prepare to die, sissy!"

fields.name: Wizard of the Unknown
fields.description: You see a fat old man in a green robe and a pointed hat. He scratches his huge belly and states, "I'm the Wizard of the Unknown! What can I do you for?"

fields.name: Gorilla
fields.description: A giant hairy killer gorilla stands in the center of the arena! He snarls and pounds on his chest violently.

fields.name: Hellious Drooling Death Zombie
fields.description: Hellious Drooling Death Zombies start running from a cage to you! They snarl and drool and moan like crazy. As usual, the Hellious Drooling Death Zombies are not here to exchange poetry.

fields.name: Conan
fields.description: The crowd goes nuts as a tall man with black hair and square features rushes at you, arms raised above his head in a gesture of victory. The crowd chants, "Conan! Conan! He's our man! If he can't slay you, nobody can!"

fields.name: Chakaal
fields.description: You see a barbarian woman 7 feet tall. She carries a six-foot longsword on her shoulder and wears hardly any clothes. She says, "I am Chakaal, and I am here to help you." She is very beautiful.

fields.name: Grim Reaper
fields.description: A tall, ghostly figure in a black cape and hood wielding a scythe turns to face you. A skull with dull yellow eyes mocks you! Your foe is none other than the dreaded Grim Reaper!

fields.name: Hellious Drooling Death Zombie
fields.description: An immense horde of Hellious Drooling Death Zombies staggers, lopes, drools, moans, slobbers and slouches its way to you. Never before have you seen so many Hellious Drooling Death Zombies, perhaps there are millions of them!

fields.name: Melancholy Reaper
fields.description: A tall, ghostly figure in a grey cloak and hood turns to meet you, your eyes greet a skull with no eyes! He begins to mutter, "Oh, I sit around and kill, but what's it all for?" He whines like a sissy-- This is a Melancholy Reaper!

fields.name: Jovial Reaper
fields.description: A big ghostly figure in a clown suit is here. The apparition turns to you and a skull headed comedian says, "Is that your face or did your neck throw up? Ha!" Wielding his puns of doom, the fiendish Jovial Reaper challenges you.

fields.name: Cheesedip God
fields.description: An immense, shapeless mass of boiling cheesedip flows up onto the altar! A giant head forms from the goop and says, "I am Sorrimat, Lord of Cheesedip! Feel my awesome wrath!" Blasts of the molten cheesedip erupt all about you!

fields.name: Mr. Roessler
fields.description: An evil man in plaid pants and wire rim glasses as black as his soul was hiding under the altar, running the equipment. He laughs, "So you've discovered my super secret plot for world domination, but I can still destroy you!"

fields.name: Joey
fields.description: You see a large, orange orangutan. He smiles one of those giant smiles only an orangutan can smile and says, "I am Joey, the world's only talking orangutan, and Sorrimat's social secretary. Prepare to die, mendicant!"

fields.name: crowd of busy people
fields.description: Here are many people busy with the selling, buying, trading, eating, making and exportation of cheesedip. A fat Kosirian merchant is packing some camels with great barrels of fine cheesedip.

fields.question: How do I get into the Sage's house?
How do I get past Manly Max?
How do I open the granite slab?
How do I get the Orb of Evanyur?
Why do some doors and containers say I have to force them open?

fields.answer:
If you don't know what's going on, try to TALK to everyone you meet. For example, in the tavern you can TALK TO IRON MIKE.

There will be a point in the game where you are incredibly outnumbered. Don't be afraid to use the FLEE command. Remember that you can flee in a specific direction (FLEE N, FLEE S, etc.)

You'll meet some allies along the way. Keep them alive; they're essential to completing the adventure.
See if you can find the Sage himself, first. TALK to the townspeople for clues.
The witches Arba and Dakarba have taken the Sage prisoner. Seek them in the mountains to the northwest.

Go west out of town, FLEE N from the Kreton army, and go north and west up the mountain. Keep going north until you meet an orc named Chichester. TALK to him and he will give you the key to Arba and Dakarba's lair. Defeat them and free the Sage, then return to town.
There is a special magic item that can help.
Seek the Wand of Castratia. It will make him less manly.
The Wand is located in the cheesedip cult's complex to the southwest of town. Look for some jars and smash them open (ATTACK JARS). Then USE WAND OF CASTRATIA in Max's presence.
Magic words are sometimes helpful in such situations. Books can be a good place to find magic words.
Read the Sage's book and then say the magic word within.

After you find the Sage and return to the city, you will go to his house and he'll ask for some brandy. You can buy it from Steel Stan (GIVE 75 TO STAN). Once you return with the brandy, you'll be able to read the Sage's book to get the magic word.
The prince wants something in return. Find the Codex, read it, and return to him for instructions.
Go past Manly Max and get to the arena. After you win the fights, the Wizard will give you the item you need. Give it to the Prince to get the Orb

To get to the Plane of Stench, get the Orb of Evanyur and say the magic words from La Codex du Cheesedip. You can do this from anywhere in the adventure. Make sure you have the Wand of Water and Frost and the Amulet of Ian, and make sure Groo is with you.
If you get stuck on the Plane of Stench (if you're missing a necessary item) you can try to use the POWER spell to teleport back to town. It sometimes works...
The Wand of Water and Frost will help you when you get to a certain hot place.
The Amulet of Ian will only work against Mr. Roessler, and it's the only way to kill him.
You'll need to locate two wands and an amulet. Don't depart for the Plane of Stench until you have them.
You'll find out later. Don't worry about it for now.
Sometimes things might be locked even if there's no key. You can break them open by attacking them, e.g., ATTACK DOOR. This won't work for everything, though.
Say DHOUD to open the granite slab. Say IMTU KHOUL to teleport to the Plane of Stench. Say CAWTEENAHMOSH from the teleporter room to return home (but kill the Cheesedip God first...)
